subject: AI & Agents
title: ImageNet: The Dataset That Sparked a Revolution
description: A short lesson to help you apply ImageNet: The Dataset That Sparked a Revolution.

hook.text: In 2009, a Stanford professor released 14 million labeled images. It changed everything.

buildup.text: Fei-Fei Li built ImageNet to give AI the visual education it had always lacked.

discovery.text: The annual ImageNet competition became the proving ground for computer vision models.

twist.text: In 2012, a deep neural network crushed the competition by a historic margin.

climax.text: That moment â€” AlexNet's victory â€” is widely considered the start of the deep learning era.

quiz.question: What was ImageNet?
options: A massive labeled image dataset for training AI
A social media platform for photos
An AI company that built robots
